LOL, I remember only Tada from you Milt, though I may be wrong. I 
thought it was Yoshi something to begin with.

For our tsuba experts here, In Tsuba, an Aesthetic guide it states that 
the first Umetada smiths signed with a different characture for Ume. 
They used ?. Then a little later on they changed to ?, the same i think 
as is on my mei. Then a little later on again, they changed back to ? or 
used a plum rebus instead of a kanji in the place of Ume. The book does 
not give the dates for these changes but I assume it was in the late 
Koto/early Edo period, around the time of the First or second 
generations. The other thing is that it may be is Ko-Umetada but I am 
looking further into that.

any thought's on this ??

Rich
